_header: Hail Mary to Thee I say
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to; prayers, to Virgin Mary
_description: John Audelay, An orison to the Virgin Mary — 177 lines, chiefly in 10-line stanzas, each line beginning ‘Hayle’ or ‘0 Ihesu’

BodDou302.First Lines:
Hayle mare to þe I sayHayle ful of grace god is with
                    þe…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…Wel ys hym þat wil & maySay þis prayere
                    eueryday
BodDou302.Attributed Title:
Hic incipiut salutaciones beate Marie virginis. Hic transire caue nisi
                        primo dicit aue. Sint semper sine ve qui michi dicit aue (f.
                        22v)
BodDou302.Editions:
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 149-55.
